{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mandibulofacial dysostosis, also known as Treacher Collins syndrome, is a genetic disorder characterized by deformities of the ears, eyes, cheekbones, and chin. The condition does not typically affect hearing or vision, ruling out options A and B. Mandibular prognathism refers to an extended lower jaw, which is not a characteristic feature of this condition. Instead, individuals with mandibulofacial dysostosis often have underdeveloped facial bones, particularly the mandible (lower jaw) and malar (cheek) bones. Vertical maxillary excess refers to an overgrowth of the upper jaw, which is also not a characteristic feature of this condition.", "answer_choice": "C. Mandibular prognathism"}
